snippet: After a four-day conference, the group of more than 900 nuns chose to “dialogue” with the hierarchy of the Roman Catholic Church over their differences and to not escalate the conflict.
abstract: Heads of the Leadership Conference of Women Religious, the nation's largest group of nuns, say they will dialogue with the hierarchy of the Roman Catholic Church rather than escalate conflict over social and political views.
lead_paragraph: After a four-day conference, the group of more than 900 nuns chose to “dialogue” with the hierarchy of the Roman Catholic Church over their differences and to not escalate the conflict.

headline.seo: National Nuns’ Group Seeks ‘Dialogue’ With Vatican
headline.main: National Nuns’ Group Dodges Showdown With Vatican
headline.print_headline: National Nuns’ Group Dodges Showdown With Vatican, Seeking ‘Dialogue’
